summary: The document is a memorandum from the CIA's Chief of Cover & Commercial Staff to the Acting General Counsel, dated November 2, 1973, concerning the discovery of an alias birth certificate issued to E. Howard Hunt under the name Edward Joseph Hamilton. This discovery was part of a larger effort to recall alias documents associated with the Bay of Pigs Operation. The memorandum highlights that this information was previously overlooked during reviews of Hunt's cover file, indicating potential gaps in the CIA's record-keeping and retrieval processes. It also sheds light on the secrecy and complexity of CIA operations, particularly the use of aliases by its operatives.
key_findings: Discovery of an alias birth certificate issued to E. Howard Hunt under the name Edward Joseph Hamilton.
The alias birth certificate was part of a broader initiative to recall alias documents related to the Bay of Pigs Operation.
Previous reviews of Hunt's cover file had missed this information, highlighting potential gaps in record-keeping and retrieval processes.
The document underscores the complexity and secrecy surrounding CIA operations and the use of aliases by its operatives.
keywords: John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act
